Class ec.e.rep.RepositoryAlias

public class RepositoryAlias
extends Object
Issues:

  • What do we do when we were called with a useful parameters argument? We used the parameters to decode the object in question. Can we still cache the object? Probably not.

RA_CACHE
RA_RETRIEVE
RE_REPLACE

RepositoryAlias(String, int)
Constructor.

getCachingPolicy(String, RtDecodingManager)
Access method for caching policy indicator
possibleValue(Repository, Repository, RtDecodingParameters)
Returns the object that the alias points to; returns null if anything went wrong.
value(Repository, Repository, RtDecodingParameters)
Returns the object that the alias points to; Throws appropriate exceptions if something goes wrong.

RA_RETRIEVE 
  public final static int RA_RETRIEVE
RA_CACHE 
  public final static int RA_CACHE
RE_REPLACE 
  public final static int RE_REPLACE

RepositoryAlias 
  public RepositoryAlias(String url,
                         int cachingPolicy)
Constructor.
Parameters:
url - - URL that the alias points to. Possibilities include:
self:#key
a record in the current repository under the new key
repository://path#key
a record in another repository
file://path
the entire contents of a file, possibly after having determined the type of data in the file using hints like file extension etc.
cachingPolicy - An int, one of the values
ec.e.rep.RepositoryAlias.RA_RETRIEVE
The data is retrieved fresh every time it is requested.
ec.e.rep.RepositoryAlias.RA_CACHE
The AliasObject caches the result after having retrieved it and returns the cached data on subsequent accesses.
ec.e.rep.RepositoryAlias.RA_REPLACE
the AliasObject saves the result after having retrieved it in place of itself in the current writable repository. This is stronger than caching since the value will replace (or at least effectively shadow) the RepositoryAlias object itself so that the original external object will never again be accessed

getCachingPolicy 
  protected int getCachingPolicy(String key,
                                 RtDecodingManager decodingManager)
Access method for caching policy indicator
possibleValue 
  protected Object possibleValue(Repository repository,
                                 Repository frontRepository,
                                 RtDecodingParameters parameters)
Returns the object that the alias points to; returns null if anything went wrong. You do not need to call this in normal use - it's called by the Repository itself.
value 
  protected Object value(Repository repository,
                         Repository frontRepository,
                         RtDecodingParameters parameters) throws FileNotFoundException, RepositoryKeyNotFoundException
Returns the object that the alias points to; Throws appropriate exceptions if something goes wrong. You do not need to call this in normal use - it's called by the Repository itself.
Parameters:
repository - The calling repository.
frontRepository - The frontmost (and writeable)repository - needed if you want to store (and override) the results in a writable repository. Could be the same one as the first parameter, or null (if you don't want to store the results)
parameters - An RtDecodingParameters collection.
